versos: (instant) 2 Corinthians 5:8 - "We are confident, I say, and willing rather to be absent from the body, and to be present with the Lord.";;;
(fan) Luke 3:17 - "His winnowing fork is in his hand to clear his threshing floor and to gather the wheat into his barn, but he will burn up the chaff with unquenchable fire.";;;

(tophet) Isaiah 30:33 - Topheth has long been prepared; it has been made ready for the king. Its fire pit has been made deep and wide, with an abundance of fire and wood; the breath of the LORD, like a stream of burning sulfur, sets it ablaze.;;;
(holding) 1 Thessalonians 5:21 - "but test everything; hold fast to what is good.";;;
(sail) Acts 27:4 "From there we put out to sea and sailed under the lee of Cyprus, because the winds were against us.";;;
(liken) Isaiah 40:18 - "To whom, then, will you liken God Or what likeness will you compare to Him";;;
(surname) Isaiah 44:5 - "One will say, 'I belong to the Lord'; another will call himself by the name of Jacob; still another will write on his hand, 'The Lord's,' and will take the name Israel.";;;
(bilhah) Genesis 35:25 - "The sons of bilhah, Rachel's maidservant: Dan and Naphtali.";;;
(bride) Revelation 21:2 - "I saw the Holy City, the new Jerusalem, coming down out of heaven from God, prepared as a bride beautifully dressed for her husband.";;;
(benaiah) 2 Samuel 23:20 - benaiah son of Jehoiada was a valiant fighter from Kabzeel
(jehoiada) 2 Kings 12:2 - "Jehoash did what was right in the eyes of the Lord all the years jehoiada the priest instructed him.";;;
(sower) Matthew 13:3 Then he told them many things in parables

(eunuch) Acts 8:36-39 - "As they traveled along the road, they came to some water and the eunuch said, 'Look, here is water. What can stand in the way of my being baptized' And he gave orders to stop the chariot. Then both Philip and the eunuch went down into the water and Philip baptized him. When they came up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord suddenly took Philip away, and the eunuch did not see him again, but went on his way rejoicing.";;;
(wondered) Luke 2:33 - The child's father and mother marveled at what was said about him.;;;
(cloke) 1 Peter 2:16 - "As free, and not using your liberty for a cloke of maliciousness, but as the servants of God.";;;
(pastors) Jeremiah 3:15 - "Then I will give you shepherds after my own heart, who will lead you with knowledge and understanding.";;;
